{"step_by_step_thinking": "Incomplete casting can occur due to various factors. To determine the cause, we need to analyze the relevant documents. Document [1] mentions that risers exist to ensure the integrity of the casting and are removed after the part has cooled. It also states that riser size, number, and placement should be carefully planned to reduce waste while filling all the shrinkage in the casting. Document [11] discusses shrinkage defects in sand castings, which can occur when standard feed metal is not available to compensate for shrinkage as the thick metal solidifies. Shrinkage defects can be split into two types: open shrinkage defects and closed shrinkage defects. Open shrinkage defects are open to the atmosphere, therefore as the shrinkage cavity forms, air compensates. Closed shrinkage defects occur when the shrinkage cavity is not open to the atmosphere. Document [15] mentions that misruns and cold shuts are closely related defects that occur when the material freezes before completely filling the mold cavity, resulting in weaker areas. Based on this information, the most likely cause of incomplete casting is shrinkage defects, specifically closed shrinkage defects.", "answer_choice": "C"}
